title: Lecture: Design for Learning by Thomas Hillman
text:
This was the first class of the year in which I took many notes.
It was also the first time I was late to class here in Sweden, annoying Thomas.
What stuck with me was the example of toothbrush design he showed us: simply making something smaller or simpler for children does not make it more accessible to them. For a long time, a child's toothbrush was like a mini version of a regular toothbrush. Turns out the dimensions made it rather complicated for children both to grip it and use it correctly! Once an ergonomic brush with a larger handle was designed, it became a bestseller. A study of behavior was essential in this case.
